title: Samsung rolling out update to control GOS now says it does not throttle non-game Android apps [U]
content:
Earlier this week Samsung was caught seemingly throttling the performance of literal thousands of Android apps through its “Game Optimizing Service” (GOS), and now the company has officially responded to those findings and will add controls in a future update.

Update 3/10: This article has been updated to reflect that Samsung’s promised update is now rolling out.

more…

The post Samsung rolling out update to control GOS now says it does not throttle non-game Android apps [U] appeared first on 9to5Google.
description: In response to recent backlash, Samsung says that its GOS on Galaxy phones will add a user option to avoid throttling on Android games.
